Articles.Content: Hi! I have a orbiter around the mun and I'm wondering where the cords are for that elusive UFO... I heard it was the south pole or somewhere around there! Thanks!
You've over-shot it. It's not on Mun. (Kerbin's north, I believe.)

You've over-shot it. It's not on Mun. (Kerbin's north, I believe.)

There's another one on the Southern pole region of the Mun. I think ScanSat can pick it up.

You've over-shot it. It's not on Mun. (Kerbin's north, I believe.)

Yes, but there's also one on the Mun.

Kerbal Maps should have it, just turn on anomalies.
There is? Learn something new every day.

There is? Learn something new every day.

Was one of the first things I "accidentally" found the first time I installed HyperEdit way back in the day. There's a lot of weird easter eggs in KSP that were only revealed to me in the last few months.

But yeah, scanning picked it up for me... Dunno what the status on scanner mods is at the moment though.

Edited February 12, 2014 by Aphox
PS I moved this to a more appropriate sub *zoop*
Thanks for all the help but can I just get a S and W cord? (I assume that's the correct anomaly from kerbal maps)

SCANsat is actually quite helpful here.

Scanning reveals the location of anomalies. On the bigger map you can see your current orbit and adjust it so that you will come in quite close to the anomaly. You either see it while flying above the area or can take a trip with a rover after landing.
I believe the values you seek are: -82.2063 : 102.9305

I believe the values you seek are: -82.2063 : 102.9305

No, that's the Munolith. Damn thing.
To be accurate it's actually a UCO. Unidentified Crashed Object. If it were still a flying object it would have an orbital track and would be easy to find.
